features: NO MORE TANGLED WIRES: Do you want to make sure your children can listen to music, podcasts, and audiobooks on the go without getting tangled up in messy cords? LilGadgets Untangled Pro Wireless Kids Headphones are the perfect solution for kids in school or toddlers at home who need a safe way to listen to their favorite tunes while they play. Sized for kids 4+, made sure to be comfortable to use. These on-ear headphones are compatible with nearly all Bluetooth devices.

SHAREPORT TECHNOLOGY: SharePort Technology allows you to connect multiple headphones to one device without needing a splitter. This makes it a convenient and cost-effective solution for kids to share audio with their family & friends from one device. This eliminates the need for additional pieces to keep track of, making it a perfect earpiece gift for toddlers. There's no need to worry about buying multiple devices or managing different audio sources. Just enjoy high-quality audio together.

SoftTouch PADDING: Children will love the specifically designed SoftTouch breathable mesh material that makes up the earpads and headband—it's so comfortable that even little ones can wear these headphones for hours on end without feeling uncomfortable. We use some nifty engineering to make sure the ear pads won't fall off which is suitable for the adventurous lifestyles of active kids, toddlers, boys, or girls. These on-ear headphones are built to last.

LONG-LASTING BATTERY LIFE: These headphones boast 12 hours of battery life & 180 hours of standby time so you can listen for hours without worrying about charging them up. And when it's time to recharge? Simply plug in the USB charging cable (included) & let your headphones charge right up again! We also included a 3.4mm cable with an inline microphone so you can use it when the battery runs out. You also get a microfiber travel bag for easy storage when traveling or storing away for future use.

VOLUME LIMITED: A quality audio solution designed for kids with internal 40mm drivers and a maximum volume limit of 93db, providing clear and distortion-free sound. The frequency range is 20Hz to 20kHz, ensuring a full and balanced audio experience. The stylish design appeals to kids and parents alike, making it a great choice for those seeking a safe and practical audio option for their kids with a focus on delivering adult-worthy sound quality.
body.description: Untangled Pro Premium Volume Limited Wired Headphones with SharePort for Kids Headphones, reimagined As the first, original Bluetooth headphones for kids, the Untangled Pro is a beautifully designed, high-quality, children’s wireless headphone for children aged 4 and up, featuring the integrated SharePort to make sharing a little easier between kiddos. Quality. Style. The Untangled Pro is durably constructed out of a high quality polycarbonate with ear pads and its headband covered with our SoftTouch breathable mesh material. Comfort. Durability. The Untangled Pro is reinforced with metal extenders for variable sizing and increased durability.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: LilGadgets’ mission is to provide kids with a premium product they can love and an experience they can enjoy. With over 6000 4-star and 5-star reviews on headphones for children of all ages, parents should feel comfortable knowing that LilGadgets stands strongly behind its products. We hope our headphones make your entire family happy and give you a chance to connect, share, and love.

Untangled Pro Premium Volume Limited Wired Headphones with SharePort for Kids Headphones, reimagined As the first, original Bluetooth headphones for kids, the Untangled Pro is a beautifully designed, high-quality, children’s wireless headphone for children aged 4 and up, featuring the integrated SharePort to make sharing a little easier between kiddos. Quality. Style. The Untangled Pro is durably constructed out of a high quality polycarbonate with ear pads and its headband covered with our SoftTouch breathable mesh material. Comfort. Durability. The Untangled Pro is reinforced with metal extenders for variable sizing and increased durability. Tech Specs Volume limited to 93db Frequency Response: 20Hz – 20kHz Battery Life: 12 hours listening and 180 hours standby 40mm drivers perfect for rendering clear sound in-ear Impedance: 30 ohms Receiver Range: approximately 30 ft. Bluetooth 4.0 (supports HSP, HFP, and A2DP/AVRCP profiles) Passive noise reduction

Unique Features Perfect for Travel With 12 hours of battery life and 180 hour standby, the Untangled Pro is perfect for traveling. A USB cable is included to recharge, as is an audio cable for wired listening when Bluetooth is not available or when the battery is drained. Ready to Rumble Made of high quality polycarbonate and reinforced stainless steel extenders, the Untangled Pro is stylish yet durable. Made for Sharing The Untangled Pro features the integrated SharePort technology, where you can connect multiple headphones to one device, no splitters needed. It’s the buddy system, reinvented. Beautifully Designed The Untangled Pro is a beautifully crafted wireless headphones for kids, offering crisp sound while being volume limited.

Integrated SharePort Technology Connect multiple headphones to one device, no splitters or special cables needed. All LilGadgets headphones come with an integrated SharePort, so you can easily share media, even if you own different headphone models!

In the Box In the Box One Untangled Pro volume limited headphone with SharePort LilGadgets high quality microfiber travel pouch LilGadgets 4 foot premium tangle-free nylon braided 3.5mm audio cable with inline microphone LilGadgets Premium Nylon USB Cable Instruction manual Perfect for Gifts and Holidays Each Untangled Pro comes in premium quality packaging, making it a perfect gift for birthdays, holidays and more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good sound and comfortable. Worth the money.
reviews.reviewText: Pretty decent. I bought two of these, one for each of my daughters. Overall they're pretty nice. The sound is good, they're a little smaller and seem to fit my 2 and 3 year old comfortably enough. Both girls like the colors (I bought a pink and purple one.) The material around the ears and the headband seem to be good quality and are soft. It pairs very easily with an iPad and there's a decent amount of feedback with the single LED on the headphones to tell you what mode it's in. What I didn't like about the headphones was cheap feel of the volume switch and the micro usb connector. I'm not sure if it's the connector or the cable that came with the headphones, but they just don't seem to fit together like all my other micro usb devices. It seems a little harder to plug in and flimsy. You have too much leverage and it would be very easy to pull what looks like a surface-mount micro usb connector right off the circuit board. The rocker switch for the volume seems flimsy, too. Like cheap components were used on the circuit boards of the headphones. The shell that surrounds the speakers seems like it could be a little thicker or more solid considering these are expected to take some abuse by kids. I was disappointed by was the volume limiting, too. It says they're limited at a certain decibel (I don't recall at the moment what that number was), but the limit was greater than the decibel limit where hearing is damaged which makes no sense to me. Also, there's no charger in the box. In my case I had a bunch laying around, but for $50 they could at least add it to the package. One of the really great features I do like is the manual cable in case the batteries die although kids can break the small plug pretty quickly with a little abuse. I'd have to think hard before buying these again. They're of good enough quality to me to consider them again but they're pretty pricey when you end up having to buy two of them at a time. If I could make changes to these headphones, I'd suggest they secure the micro usb connector better, beef up the shell around the speakers and find some way of limiting the max volume and locking it at the headphone. It's just too easy to crank these things up and no way to tell when it's on my kid's head how loud it is.*** Update 08/23/2015 ***After having some time to play around with these and really look at the spots I felt were trouble, I've come to the conclusion that the issue with the micro USB adapter is the cable and not the plug in the earphones. The plug is locked fairly solidly by the cover that surrounds the electronics so I don't think that will be an issue.I also got some information about db and what constitutes a dangerous sound level. From the information I found, the db limit on these headphones is well within the range that would protect my daughters' ears and the length of exposure to sound is a main factor in damage. This was my main concern with these headphones and it's not anymore.As far as durability goes, these things have been dropped, walked on and dragged around for a while now and have stood up without an issue. I don't think the shell will be an issue.I can comfortably say I'd recommend these for kids. They're grown-up quality in a small package.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous for Kids & Adults!
reviews.reviewText: I am a petite older woman with an exceptionally small (child-size) head. Finding a headset for personal listening for my TV has been extremely difficult and frustrating. I just got my Lil Gadgets Untangled Pro child headset and am so impressed with the comfort, ease of pairing, adjustability, quality of sound, and overall quality, I just had to write an older person's review. These are great for adults and children! I especially love that I can continue to listen to the TV from every room in my home without any disruption in sound quality because they are wireless. I wish I had purchased these when they were first introduced instead of spending time in "tech" stores and online looking for a fully adjustable - smaller, not just larger - headset. I highly recommend these for anyone with a smaller head size. They are outstanding in every way!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2014
reviews.reviewText: My girls like it a lot. I bought one for each of them. Now they wear it every time them have to watch their iPads. The great part is that they can be around us while we watch TV while they play on their iPads.Here are some of the good things about the headphones.1. It is a good fit for both my 2 year old and the 7 year old.2. They loved the colors. We bought 2, green and pink.3. The bluetooth setup is extremely easy.4. Though it wasn't easy for my 7 year old to operate at first; however, after I explained it to her she could work it on her own. It is just that an adult has to set it up first. Wasn't an issue in our case.5. Due to lack of max volume control on the iPad or the headphone, we have setup a rule while using the headphones. If we can hear the audio when my kids are wearing them, it is too loud for them. They have to bring the volume down.Here are some of the things I want LilGadgets to improve upon.1. There is a lack of literature about what kind of charging sources that could be used. Do I plug it into my iPad/iPhone chargers or the USB port of my Mac? Or can I use any other charger? What should be the power/current rating of any charger where I should plug these headphones? Eventually, I plugged it into my Mac. You have to be careful about the source you use, since it reduces the number of charging cycles the internal battery can go through. I want these headphones to last.2. The metallic part of the slider assembly that allows to expand/contract the headphones are a bit of nuisance. Sometimes my kids hair gets caught in it. The sides of the metallic slider are not beveled or rounded, and wife continued to worry that it may hurt our kids. Hasn't happened yet, but we are careful.Overall, a great pair of headphones for the price. They look great and work great.

Cumple su propósito. No he logrado modular el volumen desde los audífonos solodesde el. Dispositivo al que este conectado. Calienta las orejitas de los niños, después de un rato están todos sudado alrededor de los audífonos, uno de mis hijos solo los aguanta un rato y después sus orejas ya están cansadas. Conectados por Bluetooth si tienen límite de volumen y se escucha bien si que este al. Máximo del volumen limitado. Conectados por auxiliar no tienen volumen limitado y se Escucha mega fuerte, osea se escuchan casi como bocinas a volumen bajo... Pero pues se les baja el. Volumen desde el dispositivo.La función de conectar audífonos está buenisima para el coche donde solo puedo conectar uno.De tamaño están bien para los niños (mis hijos tienen 3 y 4, la de. 4 ya los usa extendidos)En general cumplen su función solo me hubiesen gustado mas over ear que on ear. Y no se modula el volumen desde el botón

J'ai acheté ce produit en septembre 2020. Tout allait bien jusqu'à ce que la batterie chute rapidement, maintenant ce n'est plus possible d'écouter plus d'une minute après plusieurs jours de recharge.produit à éviter donc
Muy buenos audífonos, mi hija los utiliza para sus clases desde casa y le gustan muchísimo
Muy buenos audífonos, ni hijo los utiliza para las clases desde casa y la verdad que son muy cómodos y se ven duraderos

reviews.reviewTitle: Cordless is the way to go
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE:We have now had these over 6 months. They are amazing! I wouldn’t buy any other kind of ear phones for my toddler. They’re comfortable (I’ve used them myself), easy to use and the convenience of having no cords is absolutely worth it. We’ve taken them on many road trips and they’ll be coming along on some big flights in the next few months!As usual, I did my research and also read a lot of reviews before purchasing these. We’re very happy with them! Our son is only 2.5 years but we wanted something comfortable for him to wear on a couple long flights and over vacation, that would also be useful afterwards. I am SO happy we went with cordless. They’re still a but big for him at this age but they do the trick and I’m hoping they last him a couple years. He has worn them for about an hour (for the longest period at a time) and never complained. I think he likes that they drown out the noise of busy malls or restaurants when we just need him to chill for a bit.A couple last things: - they were hard to find in store, and Amazon’s price was the best I found anyway.- It can be a little tricky to know if they’re on/conncted. When you hold down the power button the lights flash a bit but I usually have to just test it a couple times to make sure the sound is coming through.
